get.description: List the operations for the provider
List all Extensions in the cluster.

put.description: Create a new Kubernetes Cluster Extension.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Properties necessary to Create an Extension.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

patch.description: Patch an existing Kubernetes Cluster Extension.

parameters.name: patchExtension
parameters.description: Properties to Patch in an existing Extension.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

delete.description: Delete a Kubernetes Cluster Extension. This will cause the Agent to Uninstall the extension from the cluster.

parameters.name: forceDelete
parameters.description: Delete the extension resource in Azure - not the normal asynchronous delete.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

get.description: Gets details of the Flux Configuration.

put.description: Create a new Kubernetes Flux Configuration.

parameters.name: fluxConfiguration
parameters.description: Properties necessary to Create a FluxConfiguration.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

patch.description: Update an existing Kubernetes Flux Configuration.

parameters.name: fluxConfigurationPatch
parameters.description: Properties to Patch in an existing Flux Configuration.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

delete.description: This will delete the YAML file used to set up the Flux Configuration, thus stopping future sync from the source repo.

parameters.name: forceDelete
parameters.description: Delete the extension resource in Azure - not the normal asynchronous delete.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

get.description: Gets details of the Source Control Configuration.

parameters.name: sourceControlConfigurationName
parameters.description: Name of the Source Control Configuration.

put.description: Create a new Kubernetes Source Control Configuration.

parameters.name: sourceControlConfigurationName
parameters.description: Name of the Source Control Configuration.

delete.description: This will delete the YAML file used to set up the Source control configuration, thus stopping future sync from the source repo.

parameters.name: sourceControlConfigurationName
parameters.description: Name of the Source Control Configuration.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

AzureBlobDefinition.description: Parameters to reconcile to the AzureBlob source kind type.

url.description: The URL to sync for the flux configuration Azure Blob storage account.

containerName.description: The Azure Blob container name to sync from the url endpoint for the flux configuration.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the cluster Azure Blob source with the remote.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the cluster Azure Blob source with the remote.

servicePrincipal.description: Parameters to authenticate using Service Principal.

accountKey.description: The account key (shared key) to access the storage account

sasToken.description: The Shared Access token to access the storage container

managedIdentity.description: Parameters to authenticate using a Managed Identity.

localAuthRef.description: Name of a local secret on the Kubernetes cluster to use as the authentication secret rather than the managed or user-provided configuration secrets.

AzureBlobPatchDefinition.description: Parameters to reconcile to the AzureBlob source kind type.

url.description: The URL to sync for the flux configuration Azure Blob storage account.

containerName.description: The Azure Blob container name to sync from the url endpoint for the flux configuration.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the cluster Azure Blob source with the remote.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the cluster Azure Blob source with the remote.

servicePrincipal.description: Parameters to authenticate using Service Principal.

accountKey.description: The account key (shared key) to access the storage account

sasToken.description: The Shared Access token to access the storage container

managedIdentity.description: Parameters to authenticate using a Managed Identity.

localAuthRef.description: Name of a local secret on the Kubernetes cluster to use as the authentication secret rather than the managed or user-provided configuration secrets.

BucketDefinition.description: Parameters to reconcile to the Bucket source kind type.

url.description: The URL to sync for the flux configuration S3 bucket.

bucketName.description: The bucket name to sync from the url endpoint for the flux configuration.

insecure.description: Specify whether to use insecure communication when puling data from the S3 bucket.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the cluster bucket source with the remote.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the cluster bucket source with the remote.

accessKey.description: Plaintext access key used to securely access the S3 bucket

localAuthRef.description: Name of a local secret on the Kubernetes cluster to use as the authentication secret rather than the managed or user-provided configuration secrets.

BucketPatchDefinition.description: Parameters to reconcile to the Bucket source kind type.

url.description: The URL to sync for the flux configuration S3 bucket.

bucketName.description: The bucket name to sync from the url endpoint for the flux configuration.

insecure.description: Specify whether to use insecure communication when puling data from the S3 bucket.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the cluster bucket source with the remote.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the cluster bucket source with the remote.

accessKey.description: Plaintext access key used to securely access the S3 bucket

localAuthRef.description: Name of a local secret on the Kubernetes cluster to use as the authentication secret rather than the managed or user-provided configuration secrets.

ComplianceStateType.description: The compliance state of the configuration.

complianceState.description: The compliance state of the configuration.

lastConfigApplied.description: Datetime the configuration was last applied.

message.description: Message from when the configuration was applied.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

ExtensionListResult.description: The response of a Extension list operation.

value.description: The Extension items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

extensionType.description: Type of the Extension, of which this resource is an instance of.  It must be one of the Extension Types registered with Microsoft.KubernetesConfiguration by the Extension publisher.

autoUpgradeMinorVersion.description: Flag to note if this extension participates in auto upgrade of minor version, or not.

releaseTrain.description: ReleaseTrain this extension participates in for auto-upgrade (e.g. Stable, Preview, etc.) - only if autoUpgradeMinorVersion is 'true'.

version.description: User-specified version of the extension for this extension to 'pin'. To use 'version', autoUpgradeMinorVersion must be 'false'.

scope.description: Scope at which the extension is installed.

configurationSettings.description: Configuration settings, as name-value pairs for configuring this extension.

configurationProtectedSettings.description: Configuration settings that are sensitive, as name-value pairs for configuring this extension.

currentVersion.description: Currently installed version of the extension.

provisioningState.description: Status of installation of this extension.

errorInfo.description: Error information from the Agent - e.g. errors during installation.

aksAssignedIdentity.description: Identity of the Extension resource in an AKS cluster

isSystemExtension.description: Flag to note if this extension is a system extension

ExtensionPropertiesAksAssignedIdentity.description: Identity of the Extension resource in an AKS cluster

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

code.description: Status code provided by the Extension

displayStatus.description: Short description of status of the extension.

message.description: Detailed message of the status from the Extension.

time.description: DateLiteral (per ISO8601) noting the time of installation status.

FluxComplianceState.description: Compliance state of the cluster object.

FluxConfiguration.description: The Flux Configuration object returned in Get & Put response.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

FluxConfigurationListResult.description: The response of a FluxConfiguration list operation.

value.description: The FluxConfiguration items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

FluxConfigurationPatch.description: The Flux Configuration Patch Request object.

properties.description: Updatable properties of an Flux Configuration Patch Request

FluxConfigurationPatchProperties.description: Updatable properties of an Flux Configuration Patch Request

sourceKind.description: Source Kind to pull the configuration data from.

suspend.description: Whether this configuration should suspend its reconciliation of its kustomizations and sources.

gitRepository.description: Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type.

bucket.description: Parameters to reconcile to the Bucket source kind type.

azureBlob.description: Parameters to reconcile to the AzureBlob source kind type.

kustomizations.description: Array of kustomizations used to reconcile the artifact pulled by the source type on the cluster.

configurationProtectedSettings.description: Key-value pairs of protected configuration settings for the configuration

FluxConfigurationProperties.description: Properties to create a Flux Configuration resource

scope.description: Scope at which the operator will be installed.

namespace.description: The namespace to which this configuration is installed to. Maximum of 253 lower case alphanumeric characters, hyphen and period only.

sourceKind.description: Source Kind to pull the configuration data from.

suspend.description: Whether this configuration should suspend its reconciliation of its kustomizations and sources.

gitRepository.description: Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type.

bucket.description: Parameters to reconcile to the Bucket source kind type.

azureBlob.description: Parameters to reconcile to the AzureBlob source kind type.

kustomizations.description: Array of kustomizations used to reconcile the artifact pulled by the source type on the cluster.

configurationProtectedSettings.description: Key-value pairs of protected configuration settings for the configuration

statuses.description: Statuses of the Flux Kubernetes resources created by the fluxConfiguration or created by the managed objects provisioned by the fluxConfiguration.

repositoryPublicKey.description: Public Key associated with this fluxConfiguration (either generated within the cluster or provided by the user).

sourceSyncedCommitId.description: Branch and/or SHA of the source commit synced with the cluster.

sourceUpdatedAt.description: Datetime the fluxConfiguration synced its source on the cluster.

statusUpdatedAt.description: Datetime the fluxConfiguration synced its status on the cluster with Azure.

complianceState.description: Combined status of the Flux Kubernetes resources created by the fluxConfiguration or created by the managed objects.

provisioningState.description: Status of the creation of the fluxConfiguration.

errorMessage.description: Error message returned to the user in the case of provisioning failure.

GitRepositoryDefinition.description: Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type.

url.description: The URL to sync for the flux configuration git repository.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the cluster git repository source with the remote.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the cluster git repository source with the remote.

repositoryRef.description: The source reference for the GitRepository object.

sshKnownHosts.description: Base64-encoded known_hosts value containing public SSH keys required to access private git repositories over SSH

httpsUser.description: Plaintext HTTPS username used to access private git repositories over HTTPS

httpsCACert.description: Base64-encoded HTTPS certificate authority contents used to access git private git repositories over HTTPS

localAuthRef.description: Name of a local secret on the Kubernetes cluster to use as the authentication secret rather than the managed or user-provided configuration secrets.

GitRepositoryPatchDefinition.description: Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type.

url.description: The URL to sync for the flux configuration git repository.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the cluster git repository source with the remote.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the cluster git repository source with the remote.

repositoryRef.description: The source reference for the GitRepository object.

sshKnownHosts.description: Base64-encoded known_hosts value containing public SSH keys required to access private git repositories over SSH

httpsUser.description: Plaintext HTTPS username used to access private git repositories over HTTPS

httpsCACert.description: Base64-encoded HTTPS certificate authority contents used to access git private git repositories over HTTPS

localAuthRef.description: Name of a local secret on the Kubernetes cluster to use as the authentication secret rather than the managed or user-provided configuration secrets.

chartVersion.description: Version of the operator Helm chart.

chartValues.description: Values override for the operator Helm chart.

lastRevisionApplied.description: The revision number of the last released object change

helmChartRef.description: The reference to the HelmChart object used as the source to this HelmRelease

failureCount.description: Total number of times that the HelmRelease failed to install or upgrade

installFailureCount.description: Number of times that the HelmRelease failed to install

upgradeFailureCount.description: Number of times that the HelmRelease failed to upgrade

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

KustomizationDefinition.description: The Kustomization defining how to reconcile the artifact pulled by the source type on the cluster.

name.description: Name of the Kustomization, matching the key in the Kustomizations object map.

path.description: The path in the source reference to reconcile on the cluster.

dependsOn.description: Specifies other Kustomizations that this Kustomization depends on. This Kustomization will not reconcile until all dependencies have completed their reconciliation.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the Kustomization on the cluster.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the Kustomization on the cluster.

retryIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the Kustomization on the cluster in the event of failure on reconciliation.

prune.description: Enable/disable garbage collections of Kubernetes objects created by this Kustomization.

force.description: Enable/disable re-creating Kubernetes resources on the cluster when patching fails due to an immutable field change.

KustomizationPatchDefinition.description: The Kustomization defining how to reconcile the artifact pulled by the source type on the cluster.

path.description: The path in the source reference to reconcile on the cluster.

dependsOn.description: Specifies other Kustomizations that this Kustomization depends on. This Kustomization will not reconcile until all dependencies have completed their reconciliation.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum time to attempt to reconcile the Kustomization on the cluster.

syncIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the Kustomization on the cluster.

retryIntervalInSeconds.description: The interval at which to re-reconcile the Kustomization on the cluster in the event of failure on reconciliation.

prune.description: Enable/disable garbage collections of Kubernetes objects created by this Kustomization.

force.description: Enable/disable re-creating Kubernetes resources on the cluster when patching fails due to an immutable field change.

KustomizationValidationType.description: Specify whether to validate the Kubernetes objects referenced in the Kustomization before applying them to the cluster.

ManagedIdentityDefinition.description: Parameters to authenticate using a Managed Identity.

clientId.description: The client Id for authenticating a Managed Identity.

ManagedIdentityPatchDefinition.description: Parameters to authenticate using a Managed Identity.

clientId.description: The client Id for authenticating a Managed Identity.

ObjectReferenceDefinition.description: Object reference to a Kubernetes object on a cluster

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time this status condition has changed

message.description: A more verbose description of the object status condition

reason.description: Reason for the specified status condition type status

status.description: Status of the Kubernetes object condition type

type.description: Object status condition type for this object

ObjectStatusDefinition.description: Statuses of objects deployed by the user-specified kustomizations from the git repository.

complianceState.description: Compliance state of the applied object showing whether the applied object has come into a ready state on the cluster.

appliedBy.description: Object reference to the Kustomization that applied this object

statusConditions.description: List of Kubernetes object status conditions present on the cluster

helmReleaseProperties.description: Additional properties that are provided from objects of the HelmRelease kind

OperatorScopeType.description: Scope at which the operator will be installed.

properties.description: Updatable properties of an Extension Patch Request

PatchExtensionProperties.description: Updatable properties of an Extension Patch Request

autoUpgradeMinorVersion.description: Flag to note if this extension participates in auto upgrade of minor version, or not.

releaseTrain.description: ReleaseTrain this extension participates in for auto-upgrade (e.g. Stable, Preview, etc.) - only if autoUpgradeMinorVersion is 'true'.

version.description: Version of the extension for this extension, if it is 'pinned' to a specific version. autoUpgradeMinorVersion must be 'false'.

configurationSettings.description: Configuration settings, as name-value pairs for configuring this extension.

configurationProtectedSettings.description: Configuration settings that are sensitive, as name-value pairs for configuring this extension.

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

ProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

ProvisioningStateType.description: The provisioning state of the resource provider.

RepositoryRefDefinition.description: The source reference for the GitRepository object.

branch.description: The git repository branch name to checkout.

tag.description: The git repository tag name to checkout. This takes precedence over branch.

semver.description: The semver range used to match against git repository tags. This takes precedence over tag.

commit.description: The commit SHA to checkout. This value must be combined with the branch name to be valid. This takes precedence over semver.

Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

ResourceProviderOperation.description: Supported operation of this resource provider.

display.description: Display metadata associated with the operation.

isDataAction.description: The flag that indicates whether the operation applies to data plane.

ResourceProviderOperationDisplay.description: Display metadata associated with the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed.

operation.description: Type of operation: get, read, delete, etc.

Scope.description: Scope of the extension. It can be either Cluster or Namespace; but not both.

cluster.description: Specifies that the scope of the extension is Cluster

namespace.description: Specifies that the scope of the extension is Namespace

ScopeCluster.description: Specifies that the scope of the extension is Cluster

releaseNamespace.description: Namespace where the extension Release must be placed, for a Cluster scoped extension.  If this namespace does not exist, it will be created

ScopeNamespace.description: Specifies that the scope of the extension is Namespace

targetNamespace.description: Namespace where the extension will be created for an Namespace scoped extension.  If this namespace does not exist, it will be created

ScopeType.description: Scope at which the configuration will be installed.

ServicePrincipalDefinition.description: Parameters to authenticate using Service Principal.

clientId.description: The client Id for authenticating a Service Principal.

tenantId.description: The tenant Id for authenticating a Service Principal

clientSecret.description: The client secret for authenticating a Service Principal

clientCertificate.description: Base64-encoded certificate used to authenticate a Service Principal

clientCertificatePassword.description: The password for the certificate used to authenticate a Service Principal

clientCertificateSendChain.description: Specifies whether to include x5c header in client claims when acquiring a token to enable subject name / issuer based authentication for the Client Certificate

clientCertificatePassword.description: The password for the certificate used to authenticate a Service Principal

clientCertificateSendChain.description: Specifies whether to include x5c header in client claims when acquiring a token to enable subject name / issuer based authentication for the Client Certificate

SourceControlConfiguration.description: The SourceControl Configuration object returned in Get & Put response.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

SourceControlConfigurationListResult.description: The response of a SourceControlConfiguration list operation.

value.description: The SourceControlConfiguration items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

SourceControlConfigurationProperties.description: Properties to create a Source Control Configuration resource

operatorNamespace.description: The namespace to which this operator is installed to. Maximum of 253 lower case alphanumeric characters, hyphen and period only.

operatorInstanceName.description: Instance name of the operator - identifying the specific configuration.

operatorParams.description: Any Parameters for the Operator instance in string format.

configurationProtectedSettings.description: Name-value pairs of protected configuration settings for the configuration

operatorScope.description: Scope at which the operator will be installed.

repositoryPublicKey.description: Public Key associated with this SourceControl configuration (either generated within the cluster or provided by the user).

sshKnownHostsContents.description: Base64-encoded known_hosts contents containing public SSH keys required to access private Git instances

enableHelmOperator.description: Option to enable Helm Operator for this git configuration.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource provider.

SourceKindType.description: Source Kind to pull the configuration data from.
